ðŸ“Œ Important: the instruments move like chopsticks - only forward-backward, left-right.

steps.name: Isolation of the elements of the Calot triangle

description.professional:
Identification of the cystic duct, artery and hepatic duct. Blunt separation of the peritoneum. Dissection of the cystic artery (diameter 1.5-2 mm) with clipping with titanium staples. Mobilization of the neck of the gallbladder.
Instruments:
- Bipolar coagulation (LigaSure)
- Clip applicator (Hem-o-lok)
- Laparoscopic scissors
Technique:
1. Â«SkeletizationÂ» of the cystic duct
2. Â«Critical viewÂ» control - 100% identification of structures
Logistics:
- Clips are applied 2 at the proximal and distal ends
Nuance: In case of atypical anatomy - intraoperative cholangiography.
description.normal:
The surgeon finds a Â«safety triangleÂ» - between the bile duct, artery and liver. Here you need to work very carefully! The artery is clamped with clips - like small clothespins.
ðŸ“Œ Caution: if you mix up the ducts, you can damage the common bile duct - this is a serious complication.

steps.name: Cutting off and removing the gallbladder

description.professional:
Intersection of the cystic duct and artery between clips. Separation of the gallbladder from the liver bed with a harmonic scalpel (mode 3). Hemostasis of the liver bed with argon-enhanced coagulation. Removal of the bladder in an endocontainer through the umbilical port.
Instruments:
- Harmonic scalpel (Harmonic)
- Endo bag (Endo Catch)
- Irrigator-aspirator
Technique:
1. Cutting off from the liver from the neck to the bottom
2. For large stones - crushing in a container
Logistics:
- Container volume 10-15 mm
Nuance: In case of bladder perforation - sanitation with 0.05% chlorhexidine.
description.normal:
The gallbladder is cut off from the duct and carefully Â«peeled offÂ» from the liver with a special instrument that immediately cauterizes the vessels. Then it is placed in a special bag and removed through the navel.
ðŸ“Œ Interesting: if the stones are very large, they can first be crushed right in the bag!

description.professional:
Revision of the bed for hemostasis. Drainage as indicated (Blake 19Fr drainage into the subhepatic space). Removal of trocars under visual control. Suturing the aponeurosis of 10 mm Vicryl 0 ports. Application of intradermal sutures. Intraoperative cholangiography if in doubt.
Instruments:
- Absorbable suture material
- Dermabond dermal glue
- C-arm for cholangiography
Postoperative protocol:
1. Activation after 4-6 hours
2. Pain relief: Paracetamol + NSAIDs
3. Discharge on the 1-3 day
Complications:
- Damage to the common bile duct (0.3-0.5%)
- Bleeding (0.2%)
- Bile leakage (1%)
description.normal:
The surgeon checks for bleeding, washes the abdomen. The punctures are sutured - 1-2 sutures on the navel, the rest are almost invisible. After 2 hours you can drink, in the evening - get up.
ðŸ“Œ Good news: you can live a normal life without a gallbladder - the liver itself regulates the secretion of bile!

modes.professional: Radical removal of the stomach (total) or part of it (subtotal) with D2 lymph node dissection for malignant neoplasms. Includes mobilization of the stomach, intersection of vessels, reconstruction of the gastrointestinal tract (esophagojejunostomy/gastrojejunostomy), drainage.
modes.normal: Surgery for complete or partial removal of the stomach for cancer or severe ulcers. The surgeon creates a new pathway for food from the esophagus directly into the intestine.

description.professional:
Induction of general anesthesia: propofol (2 mg/kg), fentanyl (3-5 mcg/kg), rocuronium (0.6 mg/kg). Tracheal intubation, placement of a nasogastric tube. Central venous access (subclavian vein). Supine position with a cushion under the lower back. Upper midline laparotomy from the xiphoid process to the umbilicus (+ left bypass if necessary) or laparoscopic access (5 trocars).
Instruments:
- Laparotomy set
- Harmonic scalpel (LigaSure)
- Laparoscope 10 mm 30Â°
Technique:
1. In case of laparoscopy - pneumoperitoneum up to 12 mm Hg.
2. Revision of the abdominal cavity for metastases (liver, peritoneum).
Logistics:
- Marking the edges of the incision with protective napkins.
Nuance: In case of obesity (BMI> 35) - extension of the incision to the pubis.
description.normal:
The patient is put under deep anesthesia, a tube is inserted into the stomach through the nose. The surgeon makes a large incision from the sternum to the navel (or several small punctures in case of laparoscopy). First, they check for metastases in other organs.
ðŸ“Œ Important: before the incision, the abdomen is treated with iodine - as before an injection, but over a larger area.

description.professional:
Upper midline laparotomy from the xiphoid process to the navel (if necessary - bypassing it on the left). Revision of the abdominal cavity: liver, peritoneum, para-aortic lymph nodes. Determination of resectability. Installation of a retractor (for example, Omni-Tract).
Instruments:
- Valleylab electrocoagulator (60 W 'Spray' mode)
- Liver retractor
- Harmonic ultrasonic scissors
Technique:
1. With total gastrectomy - the incision is extended to 5 cm below the navel.
2. Cytological washing from the peritoneum if carcinomatosis is suspected.
Logistics:
- Marking the resection edges in the subtotal variant.
Nuance: In case of early cancer - minimally invasive access is possible (laparoscopy/robot).
description.normal:
The surgeon makes a vertical incision from the sternum to the navel. A special dilator lifts the costal arch to open access to the stomach. First, they check for metastases in the liver and peritoneum - the course of the operation depends on this.
ðŸ“Œ Important: in the early stages of cancer, surgery can be performed through punctures (laparoscopy).

description.professional:
Intersection of the gastrocolic ligament while preserving the omental arcades. Ligation of the right gastroepiploic artery at the head of the pancreas. Isolation of the lesser omentum with clipping of the left gastric artery at the point of origin from the celiac trunk. Mobilization of the duodenum (in case of total gastrectomy).
Instruments:
- LigaSure bipolar forceps
- Titanium vascular clips
- Pean dissector
Technique:
1. In case of subtotal resection - preservation of the right gastroepiploic artery.
2. Isolation of the stomach from the pancreas by blunt dissection.
Logistics:
- Marking of the proximal border (at least 5 cm from the tumor).
Nuance: In case of invasion of the pancreas - resection of the tail of the gland.
description.normal:
The surgeon carefully separates the stomach from the surrounding organs. The vessels feeding the stomach are clamped with titanium clips and crossed. Be especially careful when working with the pancreas, as it can be easily damaged.
ðŸ“Œ A tricky part: if the tumor has grown into neighboring organs, some of them will also have to be removed.

description.professional:
Removal of lymph node stations 1-12a (for total gastrectomy) or 1-7 (for subtotal). Complete isolation of the celiac trunk, common hepatic and splenic arteries. Preservation of the vagus nerves if possible. Separate marking of lymph node groups for histology.
Instruments:
- Metzenbaum scissors with microengraving
- Nerve stimulator
- Containers for lymph nodes with separate cells
Technique:
1. Layer-by-layer isolation of tissue along the arteries.
2. Coagulation of lymphatic vessels to prevent lymphorrhea.
Logistics:
- The minimum number of removed lymph nodes is 15.
Note: In case of metastases in the lymph nodes of the 16th station - palliative volume.
description.normal:
All lymph nodes around the stomach and large vessels are removed - this is where cancer primarily metastasizes. They are carefully sorted by zone and sent for urgent analysis.
ðŸ“Œ Important: sometimes Â«hiddenÂ» metastases are found - then the surgical plan changes.

description.professional:
In case of total gastrectomy: intersection of the esophagus above the cardia, the duodenum below the pylorus. Formation of the Roux-en-Y esophagojejunostomy (with an EEA 25 mm stapler or a PDS 4-0 hand suture). In case of subtotal: leaving a 3-5 cm gastric stump, side-to-side gastrojejunostomy.
Instruments:
- OrVil round stapler
- GIA 60 mm linear stapler
- PDS II suture material
Technique:
1. Length of the afferent loop 40-60 cm.
2. Intussusception of the staple line with a seromuscular suture.
Logistics:
- Checking the anastomosis for leaks with methylene blue.
Nuance: In case of obesity - interintestinal anastomosis 100 cm distal.
description.normal:
The stomach is completely or partially removed. The esophagus is directly connected to the small intestine - either Â«end to endÂ» using a circular stapler, or sutured to the side of the intestine.
ðŸ“Œ Interesting: the new Â«stomachÂ» will stretch over time and will be able to accumulate food.

description.professional:
Installation of two drains: in the stomach bed (left subphrenic) and at the anastomosis (through the jejunal loop). Layered suturing of the laparotomy wound: aponeurosis (Prolene 0), subcutaneous tissue (Vicryl 3-0), skin (stapler/subcuticular suture). Application of an aseptic dressing.
Instruments:
- Jackson-Pratt 19 Fr drain
- Mathieu needle holder
- Skin Stapler
Postoperative protocol:
1. Tube feeding from the 1st day.
2. Contrast study of the anastomosis on the 5-7th day.
3. Vitamin B12 for life.
Complications:
- Anastomotic failure (3-5%).
- Dumping syndrome (20%).
- Anemia (100% without replacement therapy).
description.normal:
Drainage tubes are placed in the abdominal cavity to drain the fluid. The incision is sutured with strong threads that will dissolve on their own. The next day, they begin to administer nutritional mixtures through a tube.
ðŸ“Œ The main thing: after removing the stomach, you will have to inject vitamin B12 for life - it can no longer be absorbed.

modes.professional: Endoscopic removal of gastric mucosal neoplasms using a diathermic loop or biopsy forceps. Includes visualization, marking, resection, and hemostasis. Control of resection depth is critical if invasive growth is suspected.
modes.normal: A flexible tube with a camera and special instruments is inserted through the mouth to cut off suspicious growths in the stomach. No incisions - only discomfort when swallowing the tube.

description.professional:
Premedication: intravenous midazolam (1-2 mg) and fentanyl (50-100 mcg). Irrigate the throat with 10% lidocaine spray. Place the mouthpiece. Position on the left side with the chin to the chest. Monitor SpOâ‚‚ and ECG.
Instruments:
- Endoscopic mouthpiece
- Aspiration pump
- IV sedation system
Technique:
1. Aspiration risk assessment (Mallampati scale).
2. Â«Thumb methodÂ» to control the depth of sedation.
Logistics:
- Check the readiness of the resuscitation equipment.
Note: During pregnancy - only superficial sedation.
description.normal:
The patient is given a sedative injection and their throat is treated with an anesthetic spray. A plastic mouthpiece is inserted between the teeth - it will protect the teeth and the endoscope itself.
ðŸ“Œ Important: you cannot eat for 8 hours before the procedure - otherwise food particles may get into the lungs!

description.professional:
Careful insertion of the endoscope (diameter 9-10 mm) through the esophagus under visual control. Air insufflation to straighten the folds of the stomach. Systematic examination: antrum, body, fundus, cardia. Photographic recording of the polyp (size, shape, stem/base).
Instruments:
- Video gastroscope with narrow-band imaging (NBI)
- COâ‚‚ insufflator
- Irrigation channel
Technique:
1. Insufflation pressure control <15 mm Hg.
2. Use of water to clean the mucosa.
Logistics:
- Marking of biopsy sites in the protocol (clockwise).
Nuance: In case of esophageal strictures, use a pediatric gastroscope.
description.normal:
The doctor carefully inserts a flexible tube through the mouth - you need to make a swallowing motion to help it pass into the esophagus. A little air is supplied to the stomach to straighten out the folds.
ðŸ“Œ An unpleasant moment: for the first 20 seconds it seems impossible to breathe - but this is a reflex, breathing is maintained through the nose!

description.professional:
Lifting the polyp by injecting a saline solution with adrenaline (1:10,000) into the submucosal layer. Marking the borders with electrocoagulation (soft mode 15 W). Assessing the depth of invasion using EUS (endoscopic ultrasound) for formations >1 cm.
Instruments:
- Injection needle 23G
- Electrocoagulator with a needle tip
- Mini ultrasound sensor 12 MHz
Technique:
1. Injection at 4 points around the polyp.
2. Creating a Â«hydraulic cushionÂ» for safety.
Logistics:
- Measuring the distance to the pyloric section.
Nuance: If GIST is suspected, refuse biopsy before resection.
description.normal:
The doctor Â«drawsÂ» a safe zone around the polyp: first, he injects a solution to lift it (like when a dentist gives an injection into the gum), then marks the boundaries with weak electric shocks.
ðŸ“Œ Smart technology: ultrasound at the tip of the endoscope checks whether the polyp has grown deep into the wall.

description.professional:
Polyp capture with a diathermic loop (size 2-3 cm) followed by coagulation (mixed mode 30 W cutting/40 W coagulation). An alternative for small polyps (<5 mm) is cold biopsy with forceps. Removal of the specimen through the mouth using a trap mesh.
Instruments:
- Snare loop made of titanium nickelide
- Biopsy forceps with a needle
- Dormia nylon mesh
Technique:
1. Capture of the polyp stalk by 1/3 from the base.
2. Gradually tightening the loop with coagulation.
3. Â«Trap methodÂ» to prevent loss of the specimen.
Logistics:
- Recording the coagulation time (not >5 sec per approach).
Nuance: If the stalk is thick, preliminary clipping is required.
description.normal:
The polyp is captured with a thin wire loop, like a lasso. A weak electric current is applied while simultaneously squeezing, resulting in a Â«cut-cauterizationÂ». The removed polyp is caught in a special basket to be extracted and sent for analysis.
ðŸ“Œ Important: if the polyp is large, they may first apply a mini-clip, like a paper clip on a bleeding vessel.

description.professional:
Coagulation of vessels in the bed with argon plasma (flow 1 l/min, power 40 W). Application of hemostatic clips (type Resolution) for arterial bleeding. Irrigation of the bed with sucralfate suspension. Repeated examination after 5 minutes to exclude delayed bleeding.
Instruments:
- Argon plasma coagulator
- Clip applicator with a rotary mechanism
- Syringe with sucralfate
Technique:
1. Â«PointÂ» coagulation mode.
2. Clipping according to the Â«sandwichÂ» principle.
3. Test with insufflation up to 20 mm Hg.
Logistics:
- Counting the used clips.
Nuance: During coagulation in the antral section - peristalsis control.
description.normal:
The removal site is treated with a Â«plasma torchÂ» - it is painless, the patient feels only slight warmth. If blood oozes, micro staples are placed. At the end, the wound is washed with a medicinal gel.
ðŸ“Œ Follow-up examination: the doctor waits 5 minutes to make sure that the bleeding will definitely not resume.

description.professional:
Aspiration of air and gastric contents. Careful removal of the endoscope with visual control of the esophagus. Observation for 2 hours using sedation. Histological examination of the preparation according to the Vienna classification protocol.
Instruments:
- Aspiration catheter
- Biopsy container with formalin
- Pulse oximeter
Postoperative protocol:
1. Fasting for 2 hours, then cold liquid.
2. Proton pump inhibitors for 4 weeks.
3. Control gastroscopy in 3-6 months.
Complications:
- Bleeding (1.5%).
- Perforation (0.3%).
- Aspiration (0.1%).
description.normal:
The doctor pumps air out of the stomach - this will reduce discomfort after the procedure. After 30 minutes, you can drink water, after 2 hours - light food.
ðŸ“Œ The main rule: if you experience sharp pain or vomiting with blood - call the doctor immediately! The results of the polyp analysis will be ready in 5-7 days.

modes.professional: Surgical elimination of a hernial defect with plastic surgery of the hernial orifice. Options: open technique (according to Lichtenstein, Sapezhko) or laparoscopic (TAPP, TEP). The choice of mesh implant and technique for closing the defect is critical.
modes.normal: Surgery to reduce the protrusion and strengthen the weak spot in the abdominal wall with a special mesh. It is performed through a small incision or punctures.

description.professional:
Choice of anesthesia: local (0.5% lidocaine) for small hernias, spinal or general anesthesia for complex cases. Marking the surgical field taking into account the type of hernia: inguinal - above the inguinal ligament, umbilical - periumbilical, femoral - below the inguinal fold. Antiseptic treatment from the xiphoid process to the pubis.
Instruments:
- Scalpel No. 15
- Farabeuf hooks
- Valleylab electrocoagulator
Technique:
1. For inguinal hernia - incision parallel to the inguinal ligament.
2. For umbilical - crescent-shaped incision below the navel.
3. In case of femoral hernia - access through the femoral canal.
Logistics:
- The boundaries of the hernial orifice are marked before dissection.
Nuance: In children under 5 years old - only suturing of the defect without mesh.
description.normal:
The patient is given an injection in the back or general anesthesia. The surgeon marks the incision site: for an inguinal hernia - in the fold between the abdomen and thigh, for an umbilical hernia - around the navel, for a femoral hernia - just below the groin. The skin is treated with iodine, as before the injection.
ðŸ“Œ Important: with local anesthesia, the patient may feel a pulling sensation, but not pain.

description.professional:
Layer-by-layer tissue dissection to the aponeurosis. Identification of the hernial sac in the fatty tissue. Careful separation from surrounding structures (spermatic cord in men, round ligament of the uterus in women). Opening the sac, revision of the contents (omentum, intestine).
Instruments:
- Mikulicz clamps
- Cooper scissors
- Atraumatic tweezers
Technique:
1. In case of strangulated hernia - assessment of intestinal viability (color, peristalsis, vascular pulsation).
2. Resection of non-viable omentum.
3. Immersion of organs back into the abdominal cavity.
Logistics:
- Strangulated tissues are checked with warm napkins for 5 minutes.
Nuance: In case of sliding hernia - special care with the bladder wall.
description.normal:
The surgeon cuts the skin and muscles, finds the Â«hernial sacÂ» - this is like an inverted pocket of the peritoneum. Carefully frees it from adhesions. If there is an intestine inside, he checks to see if it has turned blue (a sign of strangulation).
ðŸ“Œ It's scary, but true: if there is strangulation, part of the intestine can be removed if it Â«suffocatedÂ» without a blood supply.

description.professional:
Suturing the defect with a non-absorbable thread (Prolene 2-0) for small sizes. For large defects - implantation of a polypropylene mesh (size 4-5 cm larger than the hernial orifice). Fixation of the mesh with sutures or a stapler (during laparoscopy). Methods:
- According to Lichtenstein (inguinal)
- According to Sapezhko (umbilical)
- According to Bassini (femoral)
Instruments:
- Grid 15x10 cm (light weight)
- Herniostapler
- Hegar needle holder
Technique:
1. The mesh is stitched Â«overlappingÂ» with a margin of 3 cm.
2. In case of inguinal hernia - bypass the spermatic cord.
3. Control of the absence of tissue tension.
Logistics:
- The mesh is cut out according to an individual shape.
Nuance: In case of laparoscopy - preperitoneal placement of the mesh.
description.normal:
The weak spot is strengthened like a patch: either the edges are pulled together with strong threads (if the hole is small), or covered with a mesh made of synthetic material. Over time, the mesh grows through the tissues and becomes part of the body.
ðŸ“Œ Amazing: the mesh can be placed even through punctures (laparoscopy) - then the scars are almost invisible!

steps.name: Drainage and suturing of the wound

description.professional:
Installation of silicone drainage (Redon 10Fr) for large hernias. Layered suturing: aponeurosis (Prolene 0), subcutaneous tissue (Vicryl 3-0), skin (intradermal suture Monocryl 4-0). Pressure bandage for 24 hours. With laparoscopy - suturing of only ports 5 mm or more.
Instruments:
- Drainage with a flotation valve
- Suture material with an atraumatic needle
- Skin stapler (at the patient's request)
Technique:
1. Hemostasis control before closure.
2. In case of inguinal hernia - checking the blood supply to the testicle.
3. Formation of a cosmetic suture.
Logistics:
- The meshes used are registered in the card.
Nuance: In obese patients - additional fixation of the mesh with fibrin glue.
description.normal:
If there was a lot of damage - a tube is inserted to drain the fluid for 1-2 days. The muscles are sutured with strong threads that will dissolve in six months. The skin is sutured with a beautiful cosmetic suture - after healing, a thin white strip will remain.
ðŸ“Œ Life hack: after surgery, it is better to wear compression underwear - it hurts less.

description.professional:
Activation after 4-6 hours. Pain relief (paracetamol + NSAIDs). Antibiotic prophylaxis (cefazolin 1 g). Removal of stitches on the 7-10th day. Limitation of physical activity for 1 month. Follow-up examination after 1 month with ultrasound.
Instruments:
- Ultrasound machine with a linear sensor
- Thermometer for temperature monitoring
- Tonometer
Postoperative recommendations:
1. Wearing a bandage for 3-4 weeks.
2. Elimination of constipation (lactulose).
3. Gradual increase in activity.
Complications:
- Seroma (10-15%).
- Relapse (1-3% with mesh).
- Chronic pain (0.5-2%).
description.normal:
You can get up carefully in the evening. It hurts to laugh and cough for the first 3 days - it is better to press a pillow to your stomach. The stitches will be removed in a week, and in a month you can return to the gym.
ðŸ“Œ Important: if your temperature suddenly rises or the suture turns red, see a doctor immediately, it could be an infection!

keys: laparoscopic resection of the sigmoid colon
name: Laparoscopic resection of the sigmoid colon

modes.professional: Minimally invasive removal of the affected area of the sigmoid colon with the formation of anastomosis. Indications: diverticulitis, tumors, intestinal obstruction. Stages: CO2 insufflation, bowel mobilization, vessel intersection, resection, anastomosis with a circular stapler.
modes.normal: The surgeon removes the diseased section of the intestine in the shape of the letter S (sigma) through 4 small incisions and sutures the healthy ends with a special device. Recovery after this operation is 2 times faster than with the open technique.

description.professional: General endotracheal anesthesia with muscle relaxation. Catheterization of the bladder and placement of a nasogastric tube. The patient is positioned in a modified Lloyd-Davies position (lower limbs on supports, table tilted 15Â° head down). Treatment of the surgical field from the xiphoid process to the pubis.
description.normal: The patient is sedated and placed in a special position: the legs are raised, like in a gynecological chair, and the head is slightly lower than the pelvis. This is necessary for the intestines to shift and for the surgeon to work more comfortably. An antiseptic is applied to the abdomen - from the sternum to the hips.

description.professional: Creation of pneumoperitoneum with a Veress needle (CO2 pressure 12-14 mm Hg). Installation of a 5-mm optical trocar 2 cm above the navel. Insertion of a 30Â° laparoscope. Under visual control, the working ports are installed: a 12-mm trocar in the right iliac region, a 5-mm trocar in the right hypochondrium and left iliac region.
description.normal: Carbon dioxide is pumped into the abdomen through a puncture near the navel - the abdomen inflates like a balloon. This creates space for work. Then a camera is inserted and 3 more punctures are made for the instruments - all no more than 1 cm. The main Â«workingÂ» puncture is on the lower right side of the abdomen - through it remove the intestine.

description.professional: Identification of the left ureter and iliac vessels. Dissection of the peritoneum along the white line of Toldt. Mobilization of the sigmoid colon with preservation of the superior hemorrhoidal arteries. Intersection of the sigmoid vessels after clipping (Hem-o-lok) at 1 cm from the bifurcation of the aorta.
description.normal: The surgeon finds the intestine, which looks like the letter S (this is the sigma). Carefully separates it from the surrounding tissues, as if freeing the roots of a plant. He works especially carefully near the ureter - the tube that goes to the kidney. The vessels feeding the intestine are clamped with titanium clips and crossed.

description.professional: Application of linear suturing devices (Endo GIA 60 mm) to the proximal and distal sections. Resection of the intestine between the suture lines. Extraction of the preparation through the expanded port in a protective endobag. Formation of an end-to-end anastomosis with a circular stapler (EEA 28-31 mm) with tightness control.
description.normal: The diseased section of the intestine is stitched on both sides with a device that simultaneously cuts and staples. The removed intestine is placed in a special bag and pulled out through a slightly enlarged puncture. Then the ends of the intestine are connected Â«groove to grooveÂ» using a circular stapler - the device shoots two rows of titanium staples in the shape of a circle.

description.professional: Checking the anastomosis for leaks (air test under tamponade with saline solution). Hemostasis revision. Installation of drainage in the pelvic cavity through a separate puncture. Layer-by-layer suturing of ports 10 mm or more. De-sufflation of CO2 under pressure control.
description.normal: Air is pumped into the anastomosis through the anus - if there are no bubbles in the pelvis, then the suture is airtight. A thin drainage tube is inserted into the pelvis - it will remove any discharge. All punctures are sutured except one - drainage is left through it. Gas is pumped out of the abdomen, monitoring the pressure on the monitor.

description.professional: Patient activation after 6 hours. Start of oral fluid intake after peristalsis. Drainage removal on the 2nd-3rd day if there is no discharge. Discharge on the 5th-7th day if the course is uncomplicated. Control colonoscopy after 3 months.
description.normal:
Already in the evening on the day of surgery, you can sit up and drink water. The next day you are allowed to get up - this prevents adhesions. The drainage is removed when fluid stops being released. The patient usually returns home after a week.
ðŸ“Œ Main advice: for the first 2 months, follow a diet without coarse fiber so that the anastomosis heals perfectly!

modes.professional: Surgical removal of the spleen in case of injuries, hematological diseases or tumors. Performed laparoscopically (90% of cases) or openly. Critical stages: ligation of the splenic artery, mobilization of the spleen while preserving the pancreas, prevention of bleeding.
modes.normal: Surgery to remove the spleen through small punctures (laparoscopy) or an incision. After the operation, the person lives normally, but requires special vaccinations and observation.

description.professional:
General endotracheal anesthesia with muscle relaxation. The patient is positioned on the right side with a cushion under the ribs (laparoscopy) or on the back (open access). A nasogastric tube and a urinary catheter are inserted. Prophylactic antibiotic therapy (cefazolin 2 g IV).
Instruments:
- Intubation tube 7.0-8.0 mm
- Salem Sump probe 18Fr
- Foley catheter 16Fr
Technique:
1. For laparoscopy - tilt the table 45Â° to the right lateral position.
2. COâ‚‚ pressure control no higher than 12 mm Hg.
Logistics:
- Mandatory vaccination 2 weeks before the planned surgery (Pneumo-23, Menactra, Hiberix).
Nuance: In case of idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura (ITP) - preoperative immunoglobulin G.
description.normal:
The patient is put to sleep and placed on the right side, placing a pillow under the left hypochondrium. Thin tubes are inserted into the stomach and bladder - this is temporary.
ðŸ“Œ Important: before the surgery, vaccinations against dangerous infections are mandatory - without a spleen, the body becomes more vulnerable.

description.professional:
Laparoscopy: 4 ports (10 mm at the navel, 5 mm in the epigastrium and 2 in the left hypochondrium). Open access: incision along the left midclavicular line from the costal arch to the umbilicus. In case of injury - midline laparotomy. COâ‚‚ insufflation up to 12 mm Hg. Visualization of the spleen and surrounding organs.
Instruments:
- Trocars 5/10/12 mm
- Laparoscope 30Â° 10 mm
- Harmonic scalpel (Harmonic)
Technique:
1. First trocar according to Hasson (open technique).
2. In case of adhesions - an additional port in the right hypochondrium.
Logistics:
- Used gas is filtered through the AirSeal system.
Nuance: In case of splenomegaly (>20 cm) - hybrid technique with mini-laparotomy.
description.normal:
The surgeon makes 4 small incisions (0.5-1 cm) for the camera and instruments. The abdomen is filled with carbon dioxide - this creates space for work. In an open operation, a 10-15 cm incision is made on the left under the ribs.
ðŸ“Œ Interesting: an enlarged spleen sometimes has to be Â«crushedÂ» in a special bag in order to remove it through a small incision.

description.professional:
Dissection of the splenophrenic ligament. Gradual separation of the spleen from the stomach (short gastric vessels) and colon. Ligation of the splenic artery at the upper edge of the pancreas (clipping or harmonic scalpel). Control of the tail of the pancreas.
Instruments:
- LigaSure bipolar forceps
- Clip applicator (Hem-o-lok)
- Aspirator-irrigator
Technique:
1. Â«AnterogradeÂ» approach - first the artery, then the vein.
2. Coagulation of short gastric vessels from caudal to cranial.
Logistics:
- Marking the spleen poles for histology.
Nuance: In portal hypertension - initial ligation of the artery reduces blood loss by 40%.
description.normal:
The surgeon carefully Â«freesÂ» the spleen by cutting the ligaments that hold it in place. The vessels are clamped with titanium clips or Â«sealedÂ» with an ultrasonic scalpel.
ðŸ“Œ Be careful: the pancreas is Â«hidingÂ» nearby - it cannot be damaged!

description.professional:
Final intersection of the splenic artery and vein after double clipping. Extraction of the spleen in an endobag (after morcellation during laparoscopy). Inspection of the bed for bleeding. Installation of drainage at the tail of the pancreas.
Instruments:
- EndoCatch 15 mm endobag
- Morcellator (for splenomegaly)
- Jackson-Pratt 10Fr drainage
Technique:
1. The artery is ligated 1 cm from the hilum of the spleen.
2. The vein is closer to the pancreas to prevent thrombosis.
Logistics:
- The removed organ is sent for urgent histology in case of tumors.
Nuance: In case of ITP - additional search for additional lobules.
description.normal:
The main vessels of the spleen are ligated with strong threads and crossed. The organ is placed in a special bag and removed - during laparoscopy it can be pre-minced.
ðŸ“Œ Important: Always check for any extra small spleens - they can grow back!

description.professional:
Thorough coagulation of the splenic bed with an argon-enhanced coagulator. Application of a hemostatic sponge (Surgicel). Layer-by-layer suturing of wounds. With open access - suturing of the diaphragmatic surface with separate sutures. Final revision of the abdominal cavity.
Instruments:
- Argon plasma coagulator (ForceTriad)
- Floseal hemostatic matrix
- Ultrasonic scissors (Thunderbeat)
Technique:
1. Hemostasis control when COâ‚‚ pressure decreases to 8 mmHg.
2. The drainage is brought out through a separate puncture.
Logistics:
- Counting instruments and gauze pads before closing.
Nuance: With thrombocytopenia <50Ã—10â¹/l - intraoperative transfusion of platelet concentrate.
description.normal:
The surgeon checks every millimeter of the surgical area - even a small bleeding is dangerous. Finally, a drainage tube is inserted and the incisions are sutured.
ðŸ“Œ Note: after the operation, the patient spends 24 hours in intensive care under observation.

description.professional:
Monitoring hemoglobin and platelets every 6 hours. Prevention of thrombosis (low molecular weight heparin from 12 o'clock). Antibiotic therapy 24-48 hours. Removal of drainage if discharge <30 ml/day. Scheduled vaccination in 14 days (pneumococcus, meningococcus, Haemophilus influenzae).
Instruments:
- CTG machine (during pregnancy)
- Nebulizer for atelectasis prevention
- Compression stockings
Postoperative protocol:
1. Activation after 4-6 hours.
2. Diet: table #1 on the first day.
3. Ultrasound control on the 3rd day.
Complications:
- Bleeding (1-2%).
- Thrombocytosis> 1000Ã—10â¹/l (30%).
- Overvige sepsis (lifelong risk).
description.normal:
The first days, blood tests are monitored - platelets can Â«soarÂ» to huge numbers. Wearing a Â«No spleenÂ» bracelet is mandatory - this is important for doctors in emergency cases.
ðŸ“Œ The main rule: at any temperature above 38Â°C - urgently to the hospital, this could be a life-threatening infection!

modes.professional: Surgical removal of the kidney due to tumors, terminal hydronephrosis or trauma. Approaches: laparoscopic (transperitoneal/retroperitoneal) or open (lumbotomy). Control of the renal vessels and preservation of the integrity of adjacent organs are critical.
modes.normal: Surgery to remove a diseased or damaged kidney through small incisions (laparoscopy) or one large incision (open method). After the operation, you can live with one healthy kidney.

description.professional:
General endotracheal anesthesia with muscle relaxation. Catheterization of the urinary bladder. Patient position: for laparoscopy - on the side with a cushion under the costal arch (flex position), for open surgery - on the side with the lumbar region extended. Treatment of the surgical field from the xiphoid process to the pubis.
Instruments:
- Foley catheter 16Fr
- Roller for fixing the position
- Electrodes for neuromonitoring
Technique:
1. CVP control for tumors >7 cm.
2. Prevention of pressure point bedsores.
Logistics:
- Before laparoscopy â€” marking of ports under X-ray.
Nuance: In case of obesity (BMI> 35) â€” enhanced patient fixation.
description.normal:
The patient is given general anesthesia and a tube is inserted into the bladder. The patient is laid on the healthy side, with a cushion placed under the lower back â€” this makes the diseased kidney Â«more accessibleÂ». The skin is treated from the chest to the groin.
ðŸ“Œ Important: special belts are used during laparoscopy to prevent the patient from moving during the operation.

description.professional:
**Laparoscopic**: 4 ports (5-12 mm) along the pararectal line. COâ‚‚ insufflation up to 12-14 mm Hg. Dissection of the peritoneum along the Toldt line. **Open**: Lumbotomy (10-15 cm incision from the 12th rib to the iliac crest). Layer-by-layer dissection: skin, subcutaneous tissue, muscles (latissimus, external oblique, internal oblique, transverse).
Instruments:
- Hasson trocars (first port)
- Harmonic ultrasonic scissors
- Bookwalter retractor
Technique:
1. With laparoscopy â€” identification of the ureter as the first landmark.
2. With open access â€” preservation of the subcostal nerve.
Logistics:
- Used trocars are immediately washed.
Nuance: With adhesions â€” start dissection from the Â«freeÂ» zones.
description.normal:
**Laparoscopy**: The surgeon makes 3-4 small incisions (0.5-1 cm), inserts a camera and instruments. The abdomen is inflated with gas â€” like a balloon â€” to create space to work. **Open method**: A 10-15 cm incision on the side â€” the surgeon spreads the muscles manually, like drawing aside curtains.
ðŸ“Œ Interesting: during laparoscopy, the kidney is then removed through an incision in the lower abdomen â€” in women, it can be made along the bikini line.

description.professional:
Mobilization of the colon (left side â€” descending colon, right â€” ascending colon). Identification and ligation of the ureter (Hem-o-lok clips). Gradual dissection of the renal pedicle: first the artery (posterolateral), then the vein (anteromedial). Adrenal gland separation in upper pole tumors.
Instruments:
- Bipolar coagulation (LigaSure)
- Medium-Large clip applicator
- Aspirator-irrigator
Technique:
1. Â«No touchingÂ» the tumor (in oncology).
2. Â«Artery-vein-ureterÂ» sequence.
Logistics:
- Ureteral marking for the pathologist.
Nuance: In case of varicocele â€” additional ligation of the testicular vein.
description.normal:
The surgeon carefully moves the intestines, finds the ureter (looks like a white cord) and clamps it. Then he looks for the main Â«wiresÂ» of the kidney â€” the artery and vein. They need to be ligated first to prevent bleeding.
ðŸ“Œ A tricky part: the artery is usually hidden behind the vein â€” they are ligated separately with titanium staples.

description.professional:
Double clipping of the renal artery (proximally â€” 3 clips, distally â€” 2). Intersection between the clips. Similar treatment of the vein (in case of tumors â€” first the vein to reduce blood filling). Additional suturing of the vessel stump with 4-0 prolene for a diameter of >7 mm.
Instruments:
- Titanium clips (Hem-o-lok ML)
- Echelon vascular stapler
- Prolene suture material
Technique:
1. Control of abdominal aortic pulsation during left-sided nephrectomy.
2. In case of vein thrombosis - preliminary ligation.
Logistics:
- The removed clips are taken into account for the X-ray.
Nuance: In case of arterial aneurysm - proximal control before isolation.
description.normal:
The renal artery and vein are clamped with special Â«clampsÂ» (clips) and cut. If the vessels are wide, they are additionally stitched with surgical threads that do not dissolve.
ðŸ“Œ Important: before cutting, the surgeon checks three times that these are the renal vessels, and not, for example, the mesenteric artery!

description.professional:
Placing the kidney in an endo bag. During laparoscopy - expansion of one of the ports to 4-6 cm (in women - through the vagina). Morcellation is contraindicated in cancer. Revision of the bed for hemostasis (especially the adrenal gland and lumbar veins). 
Instruments: 
- Endo Catch endo bag (15 mm) 
- Morcellation clamp (only for benign processes) 
- Surgicel hemostatic sponge 
Technique: 
1. For large tumors â€” extraction in two stages (first the tumor, then the kidney).
2. Monitoring the integrity of the capsule during extraction.
Logistics:
- Tumors >7 cm are fixed with formalin before histology.
Nuance: During pregnancy â€” minimization of manipulations with the uterus.
description.normal:
The separated kidney is placed in a special container bag. During laparoscopy, it is pulled out through a slightly widened incision â€” in women, sometimes through the vagina, so that the scar is not visible.
ðŸ“Œ Shocking fact: a healthy kidney is the size of a fist, but a kidney with hydronephrosis can be the size of a football!

description.professional:
Installation of drainage in the kidney bed (silicone 19Fr). Layered suturing: for laparoscopy â€” port aponeurosis 10 mm or more (Vicryl 0), skin (Dermabond glue); for open access â€” muscles (PDS 1), subcutaneous tissue (Vicryl 2-0), skin (stapler or subcuticular suture).
Instruments:
- Jackson-Pratt drain
- Fascia stapler
- 35 mm skin stapler
Postoperative protocol:
1. Analgesia: paracetamol + NSAIDs Â± tramadol.
2. Drainage removal if discharge is <50 ml/day.
3. Creatinine control after 24 hours.
Complications:
- Bleeding (1-3%).
- Pneumothorax (if the pleura is damaged).
- Intestinal paresis (5%).
description.normal:
A drainage tube is inserted inside - it removes the ichor for 1-2 days. The muscles and skin are sutured with absorbable threads. After laparoscopy, the stitches are almost invisible - only 3-4 small dots remain.
ðŸ“Œ Good news: after 2-3 days you can eat regular food, and after a month you can exercise (but without lifting weights).

modes.professional: Emergency surgical intervention to eliminate a mechanical obstruction in the intestinal lumen. Includes laparotomy, abdominal revision, elimination of the cause of obstruction (dissection of adhesions, resection of necrotic areas, removal of a tumor/foreign body), intestinal decompression and restoration of passage. Critical is monitoring the viability of the intestine and preventing sepsis.
modes.normal: Emergency surgery when the intestine Â«blocksÂ» and stops working. The surgeon finds the problem area (adhesions, tumor, volvulus), removes the blockage and removes damaged tissue. If you delay, the intestine may rupture and peritonitis.

description.professional:
Infusion therapy (crystalloids 20-30 ml/kg) to correct dehydration. Placement of a nasogastric tube to decompress the stomach. Antibiotic prophylaxis (ceftriaxone 2 g + metronidazole 500 mg IV). Laboratory monitoring: lactate, electrolytes, leukocytes. ECG and abdominal X-ray in 2 projections (Â«Kloyber cupsÂ»).
Instruments:
- 7 Fr central venous catheter
- 18 Fr Salem Sump probe
- Intraoperative lavage aspiration device
Technique:
1. Infusion to CVP 8-12 mm Hg.
2. Aspiration of gastric contents before intubation.
3. Diuresis monitoring (>0.5 ml/kg/h).
Logistics:
- Prepare 2 abdominal drainage tubes.
Note: In case of fecaloid â€” urgent start of broad-spectrum antibiotics.
description.normal:
The patient is given an IV drip to combat dehydration, antibiotics are administered. A tube is passed through the nose into the stomach â€” it pumps out the accumulated fluid and gases, reducing the pressure.
ðŸ“Œ Important: if the X-ray shows Â«archesÂ» and Â«cupsÂ», this is a clear sign of obstruction!

description.professional:
Midline incision from the xiphoid process to the pubis (length 15-20 cm). Layered dissection: skin, subcutaneous tissue, aponeurosis, peritoneum. Evacuation of effusion (sending for bacterial culture). Revision of the abdominal cavity according to the algorithm Â«from the ligament of Treitz to the ileocecal angleÂ». Evaluation of color, peristalsis and pulsation of the mesenteric vessels.
Instruments:
- Scalpel No. 20
- Electric knife with the Â«SprayÂ» function
- Bookwalter retractor
Technique:
1. The incision is bypassed from the navel on the left for better healing.
2. In the case of an adhesive process, the entrance to the abdominal cavity in Â«cleanÂ» zone.
3. Fixation of the wound edges with sterile towels.
Logistics:
- Gloves are changed after contact with necrotic intestine.
Nuance: If ischemia is suspected - ultrasound of the mesenteric blood flow.
description.normal:
The surgeon makes a long incision in the center of the abdomen - from the sternum to the pubis. There may be cloudy fluid inside (a sign of inflammation). The intestine is swollen, like an inflated hose.
ðŸ“Œ Shock fact: with volvulus, the intestine can be black - this means that the tissue has already died!

steps.name: Search and elimination of the cause

description.professional:
In case of adhesive obstruction - careful dissection of adhesions with Metzenbaum scissors. In case of volvulus - detorsion (untwisting) of the intestine with an assessment of viability. In case of tumor â€” mobilization of the affected segment with resection of 10 cm proximally and 5 cm distally. In case of hernia â€” dissection of the strangulating ring.
Instruments:
- Soft intestinal clamps (Doyen)
- TA or GIA stapler
- Thermolaparoscopic film to protect the intestine
Technique:
1. Decompression of the intestine through a probe before manipulations.
2. Viability test: color, pulsation, peristalsis, Doppler signal.
3. In case of necrosis â€” resection within healthy tissue.
Logistics:
- Marking of the oral and aboral ends before resection.
Nuance: In case of tumor â€” urgent histology of the resection edges.
description.normal:
The surgeon finds the problem area: it can be dense adhesions (like a web), twisted intestine or a tumor. Adhesions are cut, the volvulus is untwisted. If the intestine is damaged, it is removed.
ðŸ“Œ Life hack: to check if the intestine is alive, it is poured with warm saline solution - healthy tissue turns pink and begins to move!

description.professional:
Applying intestinal clamps at the resection border. Cutting off the non-viable segment. Forming an end-to-end anastomosis with a double-row suture (internal - vicryl 3-0, external - silk 4-0). An alternative is hardware anastomosis with a circular stapler (size 25-29 mm). Checking the tightness by air insufflation.
Instruments:
- EEA suturing device
- Hegar needle holder
- PDS II suture material
Technique:
1. Â«Golden ruleÂ»: anastomosis width >2 cm.
2. Mesentery suturing with hemostasis (5-0 prolene vessel ligation).
3. Drainage of the anastomosis area.
Logistics:
- Instrument change after contact with the intestinal lumen.
Nuance: In case of peritonitis â€” stoma formation (Hartmann operation).
description.normal:
The damaged part of the intestine is cut off, and the healthy ends are sutured. It's like repairing a torn hose: the edges are cleaned and connected in two layers â€” the inner one will dissolve itself, the outer one will be removed by the doctor.
ðŸ“Œ Important: after suturing, the surgeon checks the seam by inflating it with air - if there are no bubbles, then the connection is airtight!

description.professional:
Intraoperative nasointestinal intubation with a 120 cm long probe (installation behind the anastomosis). Abdominal cavity lavage with 8-10 liters of warm saline with an antiseptic (chlorhexidine 0.05%). Installation of drains in the small pelvis and subdiaphragmatic space. Layer-by-layer suturing of the laparotomy wound, leaving a Â«plugÂ» for relaparotomy if necessary.
Instruments:
- Baker 18 Fr decompression probe
- AquaStream lavage system
- Redon 10 Fr cigar drains
Technique:
1. Manual decompression of the intestine from the contents before the anastomosis.
2. Control revision of all peritoneal pockets.
3. Suturing the aponeurosis with non-absorbable thread (Prolene 0).
Logistics:
- Counting napkins and instruments before closure.
Nuance: In case of massive contamination - temporary closure of the abdominal cavity with a mesh.
description.normal:
The intestine is washed from the inside with a long probe, removing stagnant contents. The abdominal cavity is Â«rinsedÂ» with saline until the water becomes clear. Drains are installed - tubes for draining fluid.
ðŸ“Œ Important: sometimes the abdomen is deliberately not completely sutured - if a repeat revision is needed.

description.professional:
Transfer to the intensive care unit. Continuation of antibiotic therapy for 5-7 days (meropenem 1 g x 3 times a day). Monitoring of drainage secretions (amylase, bilirubin). Gradual restoration of nutrition: from the 3rd day - parenteral, from the 5th - enteral through a tube, from the 7th - orally. Daily dressing with suture treatment. Removal of drains on the 4th-5th day.
Instruments:
- Infusomat for parenteral nutrition
- Ultrasound machine for abscess monitoring
- Dressing set with silver-containing dressings
Postoperative risks:
1. Anastomotic failure (3-5%).
2. Adhesions (15%).
3. Recurrence of obstruction (7% over 5 years).
Discharge criteria:
- Passage of stool and gases.
- Normalization of leukocytes.
- No pain on palpation.
description.normal:
The patient is in intensive care for the first few days - he receives nutrition through a vein. The drains are monitored for leakage (if bile appears, this is an alarm sign). As soon as the intestines Â«wake upÂ» (begin to rumble), give water, then broth.
ðŸ“Œ A good sign: the first independent stool means that the operation was successful!

modes.professional: A minimally invasive procedure of radio wave or laser coagulation of chronic anal fissure in order to eliminate sphincter spasm and stimulate healing. Includes anesthesia, rectoscopy, coagulation of the edges of the fissure and the bottom with the formation of a scab. An alternative to surgical sphincterotomy.
modes.normal: Painless cauterization of the anal fissure with a special device. It is done in 15 minutes, after which the wound heals without scars.

description.professional:
Cleansing enema 2 hours before surgery. The patient is positioned on the left side with the knees drawn up to the stomach. Treatment of the perianal area with an antiseptic (chlorhexidine 0.05%). Conduction anesthesia: infiltration of 2% lidocaine with adrenaline (1:200,000) along the fissure and in the projection of the sphincter. Anesthesia control after 5 minutes.
Instruments:
- 5 ml syringe with 25G needle
- Anoscope with backlight
- Rectal speculum
Technique:
1. Layer-by-layer infiltration from the skin to the submucosal layer.
2. Blocking the genital nerve in case of posterior fissure.
Logistics:
- Check sensitivity with tweezers before starting.
Nuance: In case of allergy to lidocaine - articaine 4%.
description.normal:
The patient is given a cleansing enema and placed on his side in the Â«fetal positionÂ». Anesthetic is injected around the anus - the injections are almost not felt, because the area is already inflamed. After 5 minutes they check - if everything is numb, you can begin.
ðŸ“Œ Important: this is a local anesthetic, you remain conscious, but you do not feel anything!

description.professional:
Insertion of an anoscope with lubricant gel. Visualization of the fissure (typical location is 6 o'clock on the dial). Assessment of the depth, presence of a Â«sentinel tubercleÂ» and hypertrophied anal papilla. Measurement of the length (usually 1-2 cm). Photo fixation for documentation.
Instruments:
- Rigid anoscope 30Â°
- Digital endoscopic camera
- Calibration probe
Technique:
1. Inspection of the entire circumference of the anal canal.
2. Differentiation from tumors and fistulas.
Logistics:
- Disinfection of optics after each use.
Nuance: When combined with hemorrhoids - simultaneous coagulation of nodes.
description.normal:
The doctor inserts a thin tube with a flashlight (like a small telescope) to examine the crack. Most often, it is located at the bottom, like the number 6 on a clock face. Its length is measured - usually no more than a little fingernail.
ðŸ“Œ Interesting: sometimes they find a Â«bumpÂ» at the edge of the crack - this is the skin's reaction to chronic inflammation.

description.professional:
Device settings (Surgitron or similar): power 3.5-4.5 W, Â«coagulationÂ» mode. Step-by-step treatment: first the bottom of the crack, then the edges with the capture of 2 mm of healthy tissue. The depth of action is up to the muscular layer of the sphincter. Formation of a white scab without charring. Coagulation of the hypertrophied papilla, if present.
Instruments:
- Radio wave generator
- Needle electrode 0.1 mm
- Smoke aspirator
Technique:
1. Movements from the center to the periphery.
2. Control of the depth by the change in tissue.
3. Minimization of thermal damage.
Logistics:
- Cooling of the electrode with saline.
Nuance: In case of sphincter spasm - additional pneumatic dilation.
description.normal:
With a thin electrode, similar to a needle, the doctor Â«drawsÂ» along the crack. A slight hissing is heard - this is the radio waves cauterizing the tissue. The main thing is not to miss a millimeter, but also not to touch healthy areas. A whitish crust is formed - like after a burn.
ðŸ“Œ Don't panic: it's painless, you'll feel just a slight warmth!

description.professional:
Irrigation of the wound with cold saline. Checking for bleeding under magnification. Application of ointment (Levomekol 5% or Proctozan). Insertion of a rectal suppository with anesthetic (Anestezol). Application of a sterile gauze bandage with an antiseptic.
Instruments:
- Ice-cold saline 4Â°C
- Atraumatic tampons
- Rectal suppositories with lidocaine
Technique:
1. Tightness test during straining.
2. Digital examination (only with adequate anesthesia).
Logistics:
- Disposal of disposable tips.
Nuance: For deep cracks - leave a drainage strip.
description.normal:
The wound is washed with a cold solution - check for bleeding. Then an anesthetic suppository is inserted and a bandage with ointment is applied.
ðŸ“Œ Important: the bandage should be changed as needed after the first visit to the toilet â€” the doctor will give detailed instructions.

description.professional:
Purpose: 1) Sitz baths with chamomile 3 times a day; 2) Diet with fiber 30 g / day; 3) Laxatives (Lactulose 15 ml in the morning); 4) Pain relief (Nimesulide 100 mg 2 times a day). Examination after 7 days. Ban on lifting weights for 1 month. Prognosis: healing in 2-3 weeks in 92% of patients.
Tools:
- Patient information
- Dressing kit
- Stool diary
Technique:
1. Monitoring healing using photo reports.
2. Correction of therapy in case of oozing.
Logistics:
- Telephone for emergency consultations.
Nuance: In case of relapse - consider the option of Botox.
description.normal:
After the procedure you need to: 1) Do warm baths 3 times a day (just sit in a basin with chamomile decoction); 2) Drink a lot of water and eat prunes so that the stool is soft; 3) Use pain-relieving ointment for the first 3 days. The pain will go away in 2 days, and complete healing - in 2 weeks.
ðŸ“Œ The main thing: no alcohol or spicy food for a month â€” otherwise the crack will return!

modes.professional: Radical excision of hemorrhoids with ligation of vascular pedicles. Options: open (without wound suturing), closed (with mucosal plastic surgery), submucosal (according to Parks). Hemostasis and preservation of the anal sphincter are critical.
modes.normal: Surgical removal of dilated venous nodes in the rectum. Relieves pain, bleeding and prolapse of Â«conesÂ». After the operation 2-3 days of discomfort, but forever.

description.professional:
Bowel cleansing (2 enemas with an interval of 1 hour). Patient position in a gynecological chair or on the side with knees adducted. Spinal anesthesia (0.5% bupivacaine 3 ml) or intravenous anesthesia. Treatment of the perianal area with an antiseptic (chlorhexidine 0.05%). Rectal speculum for visualization of nodes.
Instruments:
- Anoscope with lighting
- Syringe with a 25G needle for anesthesia
- Rectal speculums of the Â«wingÂ» type
Technique:
1. Infiltration of lidocaine with adrenaline around the nodes.
2. Marking the excision zones with a marker.
3. Anal reflex control (with spinal anesthesia).
Logistics:
- Used needles are immediately placed in a sharps container.
Note: During pregnancy, only local anesthesia.
description.normal:
The patient is given an enema to cleanse the intestines. They are laid on their side with their legs tucked up or in a special chair. The lumbar region is anesthetized (an injection in the back) - the lower part of the body goes numb, but consciousness is preserved. The doctor treats the skin with an antiseptic and inserts a dilator with a flashlight into the anus.
ðŸ“Œ Important: with local anesthesia, slight pulling may be felt, but there will be no pain.

description.professional:
Capture of the node with an Allis clamp. V-shaped incision of the skin at the base of the node with a #11 scalpel. Isolation of the node to the vascular pedicle. Ligation of the pedicle with absorbable thread (Vicryl 3-0). Cutting off the node above the ligature. Coagulation of small vessels with bipolar.
Instruments:
- Allis serrated clamp
- Scalpel with a narrow blade
- Bipolar forceps
Technique:
1. Maintaining Â«skin bridgesÂ» between wounds (minimum 1 cm).
2. Deep ligation of the pedicle at the internal sphincter.
3. Forming a Â«pear-shapedÂ» wound for drainage.
Logistics:
- Removed nodes are sent for histology.
Nuance: In case of thrombosed nodes, first evacuate the thrombus.
description.normal:
The surgeon grasps the Â«lumpÂ» with a special clamp and cuts it out with a triangular flap. The blood vessels at the base are tied with a self-dissolving thread - like tying a bag. The knot itself is cut off, and the wound is left open or carefully sutured.
ðŸ“Œ Illustrative moment: areas of healthy skin are always left between the wounds - this will prevent narrowing of the anus.

description.professional:
Insertion of an anal retractor. Grasping the node with an anal clamp. Excision of the mucosa above the node with an electrocoagulator. Ligation of the pedicle at the base (hemorrhoidal artery) with muscle suturing. Suturing the mucosal defect with 4-0 catgut or leaving an open wound.
Instruments:
- Fergusson retractor
- Electrocoagulator with a needle tip
- Hegar needle holder
Technique:
1. Capture of the node with the capture of 1 cm of healthy mucosa.
2. Coagulation in the Â«cutÂ» mode (30 W) to minimize bleeding.
3. Immersion suture to prevent ligature fistulas.
Logistics:
- Change of blades after each node.
Nuance: With hypertrophy of the anal papillae - simultaneous resection.
description.normal:
Using a speculum-expander, find the internal nodes above the dentate line. Each node  stitches at the base, where the feeding vessels pass, then excised. The wound is either stitched up in a Â«herringboneÂ» pattern or left to heal on its own - this depends on the technique.
ðŸ“Œ A sore point: internal nodes are usually more sensitive, so they are removed especially carefully.

description.professional:
Wound toilet: removal of clots, coagulation of bleeding vessels. Installation of hemostatic sponges (Surgicel) in the bed of the nodes. In the closed technique - suturing of wounds with 3-0 catgut to form a Â«starÂ». Drainage for extensive interventions (glove graduate).
Instruments:
- Hemostatic sponge with thrombin
- Anastomotic stapler (for circular resection)
- Penrose drainage
Technique:
1. Layer-by-layer coagulation of the node bed.
2. Â«TighteningÂ» of the mucous membrane to prevent prolapse.
3. Digital examination to control narrowing.
Logistics:
- Counting gauze balls to avoid leaving any.
Nuance: With concomitant anal fissure - dosed sphincterotomy.
description.normal:
The doctor carefully checks all wounds - cauterizes bleeding vessels, removes tissue residues. A sponge with a hemostatic drug is inserted into the anal canal. If the operation is extensive, a thin rubber tube may be left to drain the fluid.
ðŸ“Œ Post-op life hack: on the first day, apply an ice pack through the bandage - this reduces swelling.

description.professional:
Applying an ointment dressing (Levomekol 5%) with a hydroactive coating. Installing a gas outlet tube for 2 hours. Purpose: analgesics (Ketorolac 30 mg intramuscularly), laxatives (Lactulose 30 ml / day), sitz baths with chamomile from the 3rd day. Monitoring urination (catheterization if there is a delay).
Instruments:
- Rectal swab with lidocaine
- Mepore self-adhesive bandage
- Bedpan with antiseptic
Post-operative protocol:
1. First dressing after 24 hours.
2. Diet: broth, fermented milk products for 3 days.
3. Full activity in 7-10 days.
Complications:
- Bleeding (1-3%).
- Wound suppuration (2%).
- Acute urinary retention (15%).
description.normal:
After the operation, a tampon with an anesthetic and anti-inflammatory drug is inserted into the anus. A spacious gauze bandage is applied - not pressing, but absorbing discharge. The first 3 days are prescribed a low-slag diet (so as not to injure the wounds), then gradually return to normal nutrition.
ðŸ“Œ Main advice: for the first 2 weeks, you can not strain - to ease the stool, give mild laxatives.
